Key Arguments: The government is not qualified to judge what is truth or untruth.
The proposal aligns with totalitarian and communist state practices, which are not suitable for a democracy.
The bill threatens freedom of speech and individuality.
There is no clear benchmark for defining truth.
The bill poses a threat to religious freedom.
Notable Quotes: Such a concept is in keeping with a totalitarian and communist state and this has no place in our democracy.
The proposed bill is the thin end of the wedge and can only destroy individuality, prohibit reason and deny discussion.
